description: Weymouth falls....this is a sign you see on highway 101 between Digby and Yarmouth.  I always figured that the falls were destroyed when NS Power built a dam.I was so wrong!   I set off from a metal bridge downstream of the dam and made my way upstream following the west side of the Sissiboo River.   After only a few minutes, I saw the falls in the distance!  They are well hidden but so nice!   The fall a height of approximately 50ft over a few steps.On top of the fall is a man made weir which depending at the time of the year will let water run to the fall or leave them dry.  I was in luck as there was lots of water going over the weir.Once I finished my photo taking, I looked at my gps and found that the quickest way out was straight through the woods for about 200m and I ended up in the back of a church property...The falls are at most 300m away from a well travelled road making this fall easily accessible for practically anybody.
directions: From Weymouth, continue on Weymouth Falls Rd until you see the old Yarmouth Rd on your right and the church on the left.  Behind the church is a small woodland and the falls are just beyond.
title: Weymouth Fall
